35481147.review:
Игра - сон, игра - праздник...
Наверное, всем нам в детском возрасте снились удивительные сны про нащи игрушки, которые оживали, и переносили нас в свой удивительный мир. Так вот, если параллельные миры и существуют - то, вероятно, в них обязательно будет Windosill.

Игра не говорит ни одного слова, но рассказывает удивительную, по-детски серьёзную, историю маленького паровозика, который путешествует по странному миру детских снов, проходя последовательно через комнаты, которые открываются кубиками.

Мир Windosill очаровывает с первых минут. В этом мире живут привычные нам животные, предметы (да, предметы тоже живут!) и образы. Но в этом мире всё немного по-другому - например, здесь птицы также клюют дождевых червячков, но чтобы червячок выполз, нужно сделать маленький дождик, отклеив облачко...

Можно написать ещё много слов об этом шедевре, но лучше всё увидеть своими глазами.
Одиннадцать баллов из десяти.

32367814.review:
[i]„Svět v kostce.“[/i]

Jak bych to jen vyjádřil –
Ten pocit, kdy hodíte hrst listí k nebi, a sledujete jeho kolébavý tanec... To tiché zastavení, daleko od všeho, jen v objetí letního vánku a šeptajících stébel trávy... Tu chvíli, kdy zahlédnete malé dítě, jak si hraje ve světě vlastní fantazie... Ten výlet ke hvězdám, při kterém odhalíte nová souhvězdí, jen se zakloněnou hlavou... To letmé setkání, kdy vám někdo z projíždějícího vlaku, opětuje zamávání... Tu krátkou chvilku, při které se na tváři objeví úsměv...
Už vím – Radost!

A právě radosti, má tahle hra na rozdávání. Vytvořil ji Patrick Smith, zakladatel studia Vectorpark, stojící také za titulem [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/353280/Metamorphabet/]Metamorphabet[/url]. Váš úkol je snadný, v každé úrovni máte získat malou kostičku, sloužící jako klíč do další lokace. Občas stačí jen důkladný průzkum dané obrazovky, jindy je zapotřebí vyřešit lehkou hádanku, pokaždé se však dočkáte nějakého nového objevu. Tu zjistíte kdo obývá záhadnou budku, jinde zase odhalíte tajemství neznámé planety, ale dojde i na takové momenty, jako je dramatické roztahování opony. Všechno je to ovšem podané s neuvěřitelnou lehkostí a důvtipem, takže mnohdy už budete mít sice dveře odemčené, ale stejně si bude chtít ještě chvilku „pohrát“.

Kdo zná tvorbu českého studia [url=http://store.steampowered.com/bundle/272/Amanita_Bundle/]Amanita Design[/url], má velice jasnou představu o tom, jak takové veselé hrání vypadá. V každé lokaci, se totiž vedle objektů potřebných pro další postup, vyskytují také věci čistě pro radost. Může se jednat o nějaký drobný předmět, nebo třeba milou animaci. Vrcholem tvůrčího nadání, je pak brilantně navržená úroveň, která si „hraje sama“. Zde už můj široký úsměv, jen zamrzl v němém úžasu. Hra pracuje také s fyzikálními zákony, díky kterým všechny vaše zásahy, působí velmi autentickým dojmem. Zamrzí snad jen naprostá absence hudebního doprovodu, stejně jako krátká herní doba. Celá tahle nádhera, skončí zhruba za třicet minut – zážitek je to však nezapomenutelný.

Pokud tedy máte náladu na milou hříčku, plnou objevů a radosti, pak máte mé vřelé doporučení.

[i][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861342/]Další recenze na mé kurátorské stránce[/url][/i]

28691829.review:
If you are a parent of a very young child, this is a great game to play with someone in your lap, or just to get young minds moving.  A magical and safe game for younger users.  The game starts in a dark room. Players click around on semi-lit objects until they notice a bulb shape... it turns on the light!  Clicking around more makes a series of things happen until you can find a small cube hidden in each room and maneuver it as a key to opening each exit door.

I first bought this game on a laptop with a touch screen (much like a modern iPad).  My children loved exploring a magical world that changed as it was explored.  A kind of intriguing "escape the room" type of puzzle surprisingly isn't too short and keeps the player wanting to explore.  My kids and I had a lot of fun solving the rooms.

A great game for trips and keeping the kids entertained in waiting rooms or for playing together with a child on your lap.  I still keep this installed for visiting kids now that mine are mostly grown.  I just wish more of Vectorparks games were in the android store :D  Sadly, most are only for iPad.

28655964.review: This game is adorable! It's great for both children and adults alike. Yes, it is very short (I completed it in about 20 minutes collectively for the short little 2-3 minute spans I had for it), but it is HIGHLY worth it. The puzzles are fun and thoughtful. Fantastic indie game!

25769580.review:
CLICK ON EVERYTHING!!!

The greatest pleasure of this game is discovery. I don't remember what it was like going to playschool when I was a wee baby LeSauve; what it was like to learn that the crayons belong inside the lines on a book and not up my nose, or how it felt to play with a small, pink, wooden block and try to force it into a tight, round, brown hole. But I can easily imagine the playful wonder and curiosity of this game comes pretty damn close to replicating those days.

This is adult playtime in the form of a small Flash game, where every object demands to be interacted with as you click and drag and poke and prod at everything to find out what it does and how it works. Often you'll find it doesn't really do anything of significance, but that's not the point. The point is the FUN of seeing a mechanism in action, secondary to then trying to figure out if you can use it in any way to progress further.

The real goal they ask of you is to acquire a cube on each screen which acts as the key to a door that allows your little toy vehicle to pass through and onto the next screen. There are only ten screens to explore, and the whole thing shouldn't trouble you for much more than half an hour, but in that short time there's still plenty of spectacle to marvel at as almost everything seems so foreign and alien from what you're normally used to, but will still ultimately make you smile as you discover something new and delightful... just like the wonderment of that first day in playschool.

价格上说，躺在愿望单半年，难得迎来打折，虽然折扣很良心。然而期望越大失望也越大，游戏性非常糟糕，虽然简约富有想象力的画面为游戏添彩不少，但无论可玩性还是解谜难度，又或者关卡容量，都不能让人满意。综合起来，给游戏个中等评价是可以。
[h1] 但是，如果你愿意听我说废话的话，请往下看。	[/h1]

	游戏共10关，短短的10个关卡却隐含了10个人生道理:

Ein verflucht kurzes, aber innovatives, schönes und vor allem die Phantasie anregendes Spiel. 
Für alle Altersklassen absolut empfehlenswert!

Schwer zu sagen, welchem "Genre" dieses Spiel wirklich angehört. Flash-Puzzle auf jeden Fall. Klick auf alles drauf, was dir auffällt (auch ganz kleine Dinger!) schieb alles, was sich bewegen lässt, in alle möglichen Richtungen (die Physik setzt dem natürlich Grenzen); finde heraus, was was tut und nutze das erworbene Wissen dann, um dein kleines Spielzeugauto durch jede einzelne Szene auf die andere Seite zu bewegen. 

Die Wahl der Objekte und der simplizistische Grafikstil weisen auf die Phantasiewelt eines Kindes hin, in der jedes Spielzeug, jedes Puppentheater und jede einfache Zeichnung ein schräges Eigenleben entwickeln :)

21874401.review:
This is a cute game to play to relax. I bet the kids around would enjoy to play something like this

Graphics: If you're an adult, then chances are the graphics will bring your childhood back. The look of it is like combining pieces of construction paper, and have it come to life.

Gameplay: The goal of each puzzle is coming across or producing a square that fits in the hole on top of the door, then being able to get your little cart through the door.  It's more of an interactive child's puzzle that gets harder overtime.

Controls: The controls are mostly based on your mouse. There are some annoying parts to it, as you have to drag something a certain way and it refuses to work with you. Overall, not too bad. It's just about the timing.

Worth the price?: In all honesty, as short as it is, it isn't really worth 2.99 usd. To me, if any, it should be worth around a dollar or so. I recommend picking it up on a sale or in a bundle.

Overall: Although the price is a bit steep for something so short, Windosill is a nice, relaxing, small game to play when you're stress or feel nostalgic about your childhood. This game can also be enjoyed with your kids or if a kid wants to play a game on your computer. This game is a win situation for all ages. For kids: their imagination and for adults: nostalgia and relaxing yourself.

21014919.review:
[h1]Teal Deer[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Developers:[/b] Vectorpark Inc
[*][b]Publishers:[/b] Vectorpark Inc
[*][b]Initial release:[/b] May 2009
[*][b]Genre:[/b] Adventure 
[*][b]#Worth/NotWorth:[/b] #Worth
[/list]
[h1]Exposition, Concurrence and Summation[/h1]
I think... I think I have just witnessed a visualized concept of the imagination you once had and lose as you become an adult because life is a thing. And that was once present inside of you as a child when you look at something simple like a toy or a just a box on a shelf and develop impossible worlds that it could exist in right behind it. Either that, or I've gone completely insane. 

This is a physics based puzzle game on its it face. It'll physics the shit out of you. The puzzles are very simple yet obscure in their solution. Its only about 30 minutes long unless you play around with the physics for awhile. 

Either I'm having an very strong emotional reaction to this visual art piece or something has gone very wrong with my cognitive senses. I'm starting to tear up right now writing this after just finishing the game ...and I don't know why but I think I'm happy about it? 

I think you should play this.

17831256.review:
This turned out to be a weird anomaly from an unknown developer that just dropped in out of nowhere. It's hard to find anything to dislike, mostly because it's so brief, and while it's not deep, incredible or revolutionary, it harkens back to those Amanita style games that are content in being merely a short, pleasant experience with minimal gameplay elements, and that's fine by me.

[h1]Highlights[/h1]

The key to Windosill lies in the combination of the pleasant and absorbing animation, reminiscent of early Pixar works, and the incredibly smooth difficulty spike. They marry together for a soft, short and casual ride of discovery and intrigue which is best explained as simply pleasant.

[h1]Mistakes and Annoyances[/h1]

There're no mistakes to speak of with this title, and the few things that are worth mentioning are incidental. While there may be a moment or two where you wont know how to progress, and might resort to simply repeating the same incorrect step a few times, I feel like this would have become more of a problem had the game grown longer, and as it stands the frustrating part(s) are negligible.
The main concern and criticism then, is the short length of play. Average completion time sits at less than an hour, and my second run through took me less than 10 minutes. Normally I'd dismiss this concern and state that the quality of the content and the price compensate, but it may be a genuine reason not to buy if you're on a budget or looking for something deeper. I feel it would've been very simple for the developer to add another layer of content, a difficultly mechanic, a few more levels or even something as simple as hidden collectables which would've added a reason to spend more time with the title.

[h1]Recommendations[/h1]

Priced at £1.99/2.49€/$2.99 on Steam at the time of review, Windosill is worth looking out for, and the concerns about value for money in terms of length can be mitigated by waiting for a sale, but at $2.99 it's very worth picking up if you can let go of the play length.

Vector Park Inc. also have a number of demos [url=http://vectorpark.com/]available on their website[/url], playable directly from your browser which are well worth checking out, including the entire first half of Windosill.

[code]Unedited review notes 24/08/2015 for Windosill

+Strange style without forced "weirdness"
+Genuinely pleasant
-Too short, even at the low price
+First half of game available free, could be seen as a bad thing, personally find it an awesome move
+Only one annoying/frustrating part, important for this style of game
+The character isn't the central part of the game
-Secrets/extras would've went a long way in this game, perhaps for backtracking[/code]

17256931.review:
If you like puzzle games that are unusal and aren't bothered by Flash (yay 1990s!), you would probably enjoy this game. It's not long, so it's a great time-filler when you just need something to relax with an occupy your brain for a little while, (insomnia, anyone??) and it's also good when you need something that you can pick up and put down at will; you don't have to worry that something will kill you. It's a great thing to have in your back pocket for those times when you're going stir crazy because you have to wait for something and need something short to occupy your time that you can put down in a hurry whenever it's time to do whatever it is (like go with your relatives that are all FINALLY ready. Yay family reunions.)

The puzzles are pretty engaging but you can figure them out without any hair pulling especially if you're an experienced puzzle solver. I didn't have to use any guides. Each level involves moving a car from one door on the left side of the room to the door on the right, which you have to unlock. Most of the objects you can click on do something, so it's fun to see what they'll do. I was disappointed that there weren't any achievements or anything at all, but I guess that's what you can expect for such a short game. Still it is a nice time filler and I'll keep it in mind if I need something short and relaxing.

+ Positives: 
 * Whimsical art 
 * Engaging puzzles that require you to think outside the box--and sometimes even sideways!
 * Cute sound effects
 * Not too long
 * You can leave it without worry of dying (so it's safe to fall asleep. really! you can use this when you have insomnia. it's relaxing)
 * You can play with or without sound so as not to bother/wake others

- Negatives
 * Some people really don't like Flash
 * Some of the puzzles really aren't intuitive
 * It's short. Really short. Especially if you're an experienced puzzle solver. I didn't even use any guides. I saw one picture in the forums, but it didn't help me solve anything. It was just a screenshot. I didn't count, but I think there are only ten levels or so. 
 * It really isn't replayable unless you *really, REALLY* enjoyed it or want to wait a year or so until you forget most of it
 (that said you can use steam family share and let your family play it. oops, this should have gone under positives. oh well. It seemed to want to go here)
 *no achievements or Steam cards

all in all, nice short game :) I'd get it in a game package deal or on sale.

[h1]Short version: 73%[/h1]
Windosill is incredibly short and easy, but also quite cheap and fun. If you don’t mind paying this price for a 30-minute game, then go for it!

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Vectorpark is the creator of several very short Flash-based artistic puzzle games for handheld devices. Windosill is one of their full games available for PC.

Although classified as point ‘n’ click, Windosill is actually a room-by-room puzzle game – there is no story or dialogue, you just find a cube to open the door and proceed. Repeat ten times to win, which takes about 15 to 30 minutes.
The puzzles tend to be on the verge of getting you stuck, but not as much to resort to a guide. In this regard, the difficulty is casual level, but perfect.

So… it is cheap, the art design is simplistic but great, and if you don’t mind the price, get it and have a little fun with it.

16375692.review:
The most important thing you need to know is that this game is EXTREMELY SHORT. You can beat it in about 30 minutes, give or take (depending on how clever you are).

That being said, it is an extremely imaginative point-and-click puzzle game. In some ways it feels similar to Myst games in that you are presented with weird objects that do things when you interact with them, but you don't know what the objects are, and it's not clear at first why these objects do these things or what purpose it could possibly serve. So you just sort of tinker around with what you see until all of a sudden something clicks.

At the same time, this game is sort of unlike a lot of puzzles and point-and-click games in that there are all kinds of superfluous interactions with objects you can have for no reason other than to engage your imagination and wonder. In that way it sort of reminds me of the old Living Books series (ask your parents) where you could click on a bunch of things in a scene and random things would happen for no particular reason. It was just fun to find them and watch them.

A cool little game, but really very short.

This game made me giggle like a maniac!

It's very short - it took me an hour to finish and I kind of suck at games - but it's extremely cute and utterly charming. Each level centres around finding a small box, using it to open a door, and getting your little toy train character through the door. Playing levels mainly goes like this:
"Ah what a pretty place! Let me just poke some things and see what they do."
"Heehee that's adorable. <3"
"Okay let's do the puzzle."
"I don't understand the puzzle!"
"Ah okay that's how you do it. Let's poke some more things!"
"I've poked everything there is to poke. Onwards!"

If you like colourful, fairly simplistic puzzles and enjoy playing with your environment, then you might like this game. It really benefits from not being too fussed about finishing the level in record time or whatever, but being more interested in looking around and enjoying yourself, while incidentally progressing from level to level.

Windosill is a "point and click adventure game" where you have to get a toy car from room to room. You have obstacles in your way and you need a key for every room.

Buy it if you have money to spend. Other than that, just don't.

Windosill is a Flash game that was released in 2009 and then later ported onto smartphone. You can say that it's point'n'click adventure, but actually it's a short toybox, so to say. You can check out demo at Windosill site, which is half of  a game.

Now, game only has 10 or so rooms (screens). Objective of which is to find a cube to unlock door and get wagon through door. Puzzles aren't compilated or hardcore and game will take maximum half-hour to beat with no real replaybility.

And I probably should not recommend this game due to being so short and not gamey, but it's a little curiousity. A toy box. Using mouse, you get to interact with various objects. Game is quite calming experience, yet not complete bore. There is no music, just simple sounds. I also found animation and physics quite impressive for Flash game, lovely. Still no idea to who I can recommend this at all, but it's a little curious thing.

15084770.review:
Yet another puzzle game in the style of Amanita creations, with a very distinctive surrealistic art.

The game consists of 11 levels that have the same goal: you are required to move a toy car from one side on the room to another, by interacting with different abstract objects in a certain order. The objects react differently to your clicks, they surprise you with their reactions and discovering their meanings or roles is part of the fun of solving every puzzle. Putting it all together makes use of your creative thinking and seeing the picture in full is a very satisfying feeling.

What I liked a lot about this game was the difficulty of the levels: they’re neither too simplistic, nor too challenging, just the right amount to keep you wanting to solve the puzzle by yourself while being tempted to check a guide. I personally didn’t need to check a guide and I managed to find the solution to every puzzle only after a few minutes of poking around. The solution was never obvious, but the puzzles are designed so that you’ll always figure it out.

I think that this game would fit better on a touch screen device than on PC since it consists in a lot of experimenting with objects, clicking them or dragging them, and there’s no time limit or time requirement to solve the puzzles.

Although it’s quite short (45 mins – 1h), Windosill is a wonderful and relaxing experience, and I think it’s worth the price.

This is a short game (less than 45 minutes of gameplay), but it is bursting with creativity and charm.  You will have just as much fun clicking on all the random extras in the levels as you will trying to solve the puzzles.

The challenges are fairly straightforward, incorporating skills such as pattern recognition, memory, and sequential task management.  There are no instructions; the puzzles are intuitive, and rely on your sense of play and exploration to uncover the clues to solve each level.  

Gameplay is entirely mouse-based (clicking, clicking and dragging, clicking and holding, etc.).

While there is not much replay value for adults, I feel this would be a great learning game for kids, encouraging them to think outside the box.

Overall, I would give this game an 8.5/10

12192443.review:
Windosill is a short game released in 2009 through digital distribution channels by web-artist and painter Patrick Smith (usually known as Vectorpark). Windosill's aim is to inspire in the player a child-like wonder and sense of discovery (Smith, 2009), presenting him with an interactive world made by a series of rooms that can be progressed by resolving very simple point-and-click puzzles. However, those puzzle, while being the core element of the "gameplay", are not Windosill's main interactive focus. In fact the game is much more oriented on immersing the player in its abstract world. This aim is reflected by the puzzle design that, if on one hand is very simplistic, on the other forces the player to explore the environments and to interact with every element that he can see, since the abstract nature of the game makes it practically impossible to quickly resolve the puzzles on the first try. The absence of the need for complex reasoning is also another element that helps the player focusing on enjoying the world and the experience [...]

Full Article: http://www.scriptaludica.com/

Windowsill is not so much a game, but more like a series of interactive pieces of digital art. There is an objective to click around and find a small white cube, which allows you to progress to the next area, but that's about it.

It will take maybe half an hour to get through, but you will probably want to spend more time than that (but not a lot). I don't even like the art style that much, and I enjoyed playing with the interactive objects for a little while (a very little while).

Very very very short. I got this as part of a bundle, otherwise I probably would not have bought it. Recommended only if you appreciate this type of art.

It's an escape game.  Nothing more complicated than that.  If you like simple puzzles with basic control mechanics, then it seems to be made solidly.  As with all of these types of games, you can simply get stuck on a single room like a napkin on a cinnabun.  I like and hate this all at the same time.  I want a challenge, but I obviously don't want to be stopped from playing the game.  This was me around room 8 or so.  I gave it a break, went back to it… nothing.  And so ends Windowsill for me.

I'd call this worth it at $2.  It feels like something I would get for free in a browser on 50 different flash game site, but on the flip side, it's top notch for style and execution.

6 for Visuals

9271967.review:
Petit jeu de réflexion, point and klick, Windosill nous plonge dans un univers particulier, où l'on dirige un petit véhicule cherchant à passer de fenêtre en en fenêtre. 

Ce jeu à des couleurs de jeux pilotes, essai ou démo technique (ou graphique), tant sa durée de vie est faible. Il faut compter 20 à 30 minutes pour le premier run, et 5 à 10 minutes pour les suivants. Je dit "suivants" car, bien que ce jeu soit très court, il n'en reste pas moins bon. J'ai du le recommancer une bonne dizaine de fois, rien que pour me remettre dans l'ambiance. En effet, il présente une ambiance très épurée, calme mais aussi fantastique, voir glauque à certains passages. Les interractions avec les objets présents dans le jeu sont interressante. Je me suis dailleurs pris de d'admiration pour la "main correctrice" du niveau 2, cherchant à corriger nos pulsions désordonnées de "cliquer sur tout".... et bien d'autres situations sympatiques. Une bonne ambiance  et une bonne surprise! Les énigmes du jeu restent accessibles et bien pensées. 


En bref, un bon petit jeu, que l'on aime faire partager à nos amis ou à notre famille rien que pour les voir galérer pendant 20 minutes. On en ressort dépaysé et joyeux. On aurait cependant aimer poursuivre l'aventure plus longtemps.

9193128.review:
There is an inherently charming and magical quality Windosill; an enchanting playfulness that can't properly be put into words and is better enjoyed first hand. A point and click puzzle game encompassing ten inordinately imaginative rooms, it's neither challenging nor lengthy, but in the same way a short picture book can be hugely delightful, Windosill succeeds because of its simple design and childish sensibilities.

There is not a whole lot more I could say about Vectorpark's bite-sized treat of a game, and hopefully I don't need to to convince you it's worth your time. It's a brief expedition (about 30 minutes, depending on how good you are at puzzle solving) to another world, full of strange sounds and bizarre creatures, that is entirely unassuming in its execution. A gorgeous artistic endeavor, it shows that sometimes all a game needs to be worthwhile is a clear vision and a lot of passion to back it up. 

It's the sort of game that is effortlessly relaxing; best enjoyed curled up with a blanket next to the fire, sipping a cup of cocoa and just enjoying life.

[b]You can read more of my writing on [url=http://kritiqal.com/2014/02/20/quick-thoughts-on-windosill/]Kritiqal[/url].[/b]

8949503.review:
再三犹豫之后，还是给了本作“推荐”的评价。购买本作前请务必三思，这只是个小flash游戏而已。
作为一款小巧的flash解密游戏，本作内容极少，但设计精巧，价格低廉，总体而言颇有趣处，可作为喜+1的一个填补选择。或你购买过之前含本作的humblebundle慈善包的话，也推荐拿出来一玩。
本作流程是扮演一辆小木车，通过点击每幕场景的物件互动，想尽办法获取方块，从而开启大门过关。总共分为10幕场景，各幕需要互动的次数和复杂度均不高，可能仅需几分钟即可轻易完成，因此本作的流程时间极其短，一般不足1小时即告结束，除了重新通关，也没有任何可重复的内容。
不过对各物件的设计看出了设计者的用心，物件动作和反应细节做的比较用心仔细（仅就flash游戏而言），画面风格充满了悠闲童趣，谜题的设计并不复杂困难，稍加尝试即可解决，但部分设计又颇为精妙，出人意料之外。
本作注定不适合大量玩家，但绝非一文不值，试着玩一下，或许会对你的胃口。
PS：本作本体是flash程序，因此可脱离steam单独运行。

In each room it enters, it must somehow find a cube used to open the door to the next room. The puzzles make you think very creatively, doing things you don't normally do in a game. The graphics and art are gorgeous and you can tell the developer has paid attention to every tiny detail, because almost every object can be clicked and interacted with. The first time I did it, it took roughly an hour, and it has good replayability because you can time yourself and try to beat your best time. Overall, I enjoyed Windosill very much, and for the price (especially if you buy it from the Humble Store for $.99), you can't go wrong.

8795211.review:
「パズルゲームの隠れた名作」

天才パトリック・スミスのスピリットが存分に注ぎ込まれたWindosillは、
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/40720/?snr=1_7_7_151_150_1] samorost [/url] や [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/40700/?snr=1_7_7_151_150_1] machinarium [/url] と並ぶパズルアドベンチャーの名作である。

ゲームの目的はただ一つ「積木の機関車を先に進めること」。
しかし待って欲しい、このゲームの真髄は先に進むことではなく
「作りこまれたオブジェクトに干渉し、隠されたギミックに感嘆すること」なのだから。

プレイヤーの干渉により配置された物体に命が宿る、あるものは空を自由に飛び回り
あるものは花を咲かせる。
そして驚くことに、それらの物体は自律行動をしながら他の物体と協調する事もあるのだ。

この作品ほど極端に評価が別れるものは無いだろう。
この作品はたった14MBしかない、画面数も10面しかなく答えを知っていると1分で終わる。
しかし、ワクワクしながら隠された秘密を探して楽しめれば、何度もこの世界を訪れることになるだろう。

ゲームの素晴らしさと容量は関係ない、クリアだけが目的なら別のゲームをやればいい。
子供の心を持つ大人なら、この作品の素晴らしさに気づくはずだ。

DAYDREAMING

Windosill

I bought this game because it was on sale along with a package “humble bundle” then i didn’t pay attention, I played a bit the rest of the games but no Windosill. Um eines vorweg zu nehmen: Windosill ist kein Spiel im eigentlichen Sinne, sondern eher als Kunst anzusehen. 

Es besteht aus zehn Teilen, die alle das gleiche Ziel haben: eine kleine weiße Kiste suchen, um die Lok durch die nächste Tür zu fahren. Klingt simpel, ist es aber nicht immer. Mal muss man geschickt kombinieren, mal wild herumprobieren ;).

Musik gibt es keine, dafür mit viel Liebe fürrs Detail plazierte Geräusche. Diese Liebe findet man auch in der Optik wieder, da die einzelnen Ebenen simpel aber detailliert sind, und jede ihr eigenes Thema besitzt.

Einziger kleiner Kritikpunkt ist das Preis/Leistungsverhältnis. Das Spiel ist wirklich nett und schön aufgemacht, jedoch (wenn man sich geschickt anstellt) schneller vorbei als gedacht. Das ist zum einen Schade weil die Demo schon die Hälfte vorwegnimmt, man gerne einiges an Ebenen mehr gehabt hätte, und zum anderen weil (wenn man es aus der rein spielerischen Sicht sieht) für den Preis einfach bei manch anderem Spiel auf Steam mehr drin ist :/.

Dennoch ist Windosill ein Tipp, einfach weil es wunderschön ist und man für (sehr) kurze Zeit gut dran knobeln kann.

This game is so amazing I cant even stand it. First of all, let me just say. You have no reason to not have this right now because its only like 3 dollars!? I'd buy it for 15 at least! 
Alright, so why is this game so cool? For me the thing I loved most about this game was the way it felt. Everything feels so perfect to interact with. The gameplay itself is immsersive. Everything moves very realistically, and nothing breaks and you can't get an object stuck anywhere. Its solid. It feels like your really just reaching out and touching and exploring the world. 

And the world is so creative. The art style is so clean, but simple. It's like an old kids book almost. And everything so weird, but strangly peaceful too. And ontop of that the puzzles are fun to figure out. None of the puzzles are particually hard to figure out, but the answers are never obvious either. 

You know what this game is like? You remeber Gepetto? The guy from Pinocchio? He had all sorts of weird little wooden clocks in his store. Very bizzare, always strange those clocks. but they were all charming in a way too. Thats sort of what this game is like. Each room gives you a bunch of strange little toys to interact with, and it's all very charming. Everything is a charming surprise in this game. I'm just really blown away by it all really.  

Words REALLY don't help for this game though, because the main appeal to the game is how it feels. You definitly need to play this game.

8554280.review:
Un juego en Flash de point-and-click, en el que recorremos un mundo extraño: una caja de juguetes llena de vida. Parece ser más apropiado para una tablet o un dispositivo móvil que para el PC, que es donde yo juego. Esto, junto a sus intenciones, y junto al hecho de que pretende ser visual, provoca que este análisis no le haga justicia (pero yo tengo que atenerme a mis criterios). 

-Jugabilidad: puntero y hacer click, es más simple que el mecanismo de un botijo (¡Pero cuidado! a veces hay que arrastrar...). Y no es que sea bueno o malo, es que ése es el objetivo del creador de este juego. Después de la tendencia actual a videojuegos de mecánica complicada, largos tutoriales y muchas instrucciones, este juego busca salir de la tendencia... y lo consigue.

-Gráficos: un dibujo bonito, limpio y en tonos claros y pasteles. El estilo se sitúa entre juguetes tiernos y los típicos dibujos británicos de caricatura propios de películas de los Monty Python (como los de la apertura de La Vida de Brian).

-Guión: el juego es muy corto, demasiado corto. Al jugarlo tuve la sensación de que busca alargar su duración con puzzles enrevesados, y es verdad que a veces lo consigue... Pero quince minutos de duración es muy poco para un juego que no da posibilidad de volver a ser jugado (me refiero a juegos que pese a durar quince minutos, te plantean desafíos generados aleatoriamente y se prestan a volver a ser jugados), sea como sea. 

-Trama: el juego es una caja de juguetes llena de locura, vida y extravagancia. Está bien ambientado y ningún ente/objeto/cosa se sale de esa ambientación. Tal vez, su corta duración haga que no te de tiempo a sentirte dentro de ese mundo por completo. A pesar de todo esto, sí que te deja con ganas de saber más sobre ese mundo extraño y vivo que presenta.

-Música: escasa o ausente. Como mucho se oyen los sonidos de los objetos, y tampoco son tantos. Este juego necesita música (una música de juguete de cuna sería ideal) y más efectos de sonido (por supuesto, no hablo de explosiones, sino de efectos que sigan la línea de los que ya tiene, que de por sí ya son buenos).

Jugabilidad: cumple sus objetivos con creces 4/5
Gráficos: es más arte que juego 4.5/5
Guión: quince minutos 1/5
Trama: ambiente exótico y fuera de tendencias 3.5/5
Música: escasa 0.5/5

Valoración global: ¿Pese a todo lo escrito aquí, recomiendas este juego? Pues sí, porque como he dicho, es más arte que juego. Si quieres jugar como el que visita un museo interactivo, adelante, juega. Si buscas otra cosa, este no es tu juego.

7763730.review:
[i]Ну вот и остались мы вдвоём: я и мой синий паровозик [/i]

Windosill это чудесная сюрреалистическая интерактивная выставка от разработчиков Vectorpark, которые известны своими нестандартными подходами к своим произведениям (на данный момент у них имеется несколько проектов на мобильных платформах). Для меня (автора рецензии) игры - это искусство и если вы думаете так же как и я, то смело сметайте эту игру с "виртуальных полок"! 

Сюжет... Ну сюжет у этой игры достаточно прост. Вот есть паровозик, а вот кубик и если вы правильно используйте эти переменные, то уровень ваш. Но не всё так просто, меняется уровень, а значит, и меняются условия получения желанного кубика (головоломка как никак). 
 
Что касается графики, то она здесь представлена на высшем уровне (хорошая и красивая графика это вам не только полигоны и шейдеры! ). Всё, как и полагается: свой стиль, отличная рисовка. При желании можно сделать скриншот, распечатать его, повесить в рамку и *бам* у вас получается отличная картина. Настолько хорошая там графика. 

Если говорить о "интерактивности", то игра полностью пропитана ею. Порой и уровень не пройдёшь, не взаимодействую с каким-нибудь невзрачным голубым облачком. 
 
Под конец поговорим о минусах. Она достаточно коротка. Но разве для произведения  искусства это минус? Ведь можно весело скоротать время, пока, к примеру будите ждать человека на встрече (который постоянно опаздывает). Да вы даже на него не обидитесь, так как к тому времени когда ваш товарищ придёт игра уже будет пройдена :) ... игру ведь и на свой смартфон скачать можно.

You can play the first half of the game on their website, it's really good. You play as this little car thing and you try to get to the next area. One of my favorite areas is one with a large multiple eyed complacent monster, a much smaller purple one and then a large snake with a birds beak. When you roll in, the large eyed monster gently rolls your car back and forth, then towards the smaller one. The smaller one picks it up and rolls the wheels on the ground and rolls it to the last monster which picks it up with it's mouth and throws it around back to the first. For whatever reason this really reminded me of childhood memories and it made me smile a lot. It's hard to describe, just play

E' difficile valutare questo titolo, principalmente perchè non è un gioco, ma piuttosto un parco giochi.
Impersoneremo una simpatica automobilina giocattolo che dovrà attraversare una serie di stanze in successione risolvendo alcuni enigmi veramente fantasiosi.
Giocandolo in maniera brutale, con il solo scopo di risolvere gli enigmi e finirlo, si brucierà il titolo nel giro di tre quarti d'ora, peccato che questo sia il modo più stupido per affrontare questo "gioco".
Credo che l'approccio migliore per avvicinarsi a Windosill sia quello di dimenticarsi di essere delle macchine macina videogiochi ed immaginarsi di essere bambini, in quest'ottica non penseremo solo a risolvere degli enigmi, ma ci potremo perdere interagendo con una serie di "giocattoli" straordinari che troveremo sparsi lungo tutto il titolo e quando ci renderemo conto di aver passato 20 minuti semplicemente a buttare a terra lettere, ad aprire porticine, a giocare con un pallone, avremo capito la magia di Windosill

28470.review:
Windowsill is an adventure game in the purest sense: a series of beautiful, whimsical, and highly interactive collages that you need to "solve" in order to make progress. You'll be spending half your time poking at the scenery to find out what delightful bit of interactivity is hiding under your cursor. It's not long, but it doesn't have to be: I thoroughly enjoyed every minute of my playthrough.  

As a programmer, what really amazes me about this game is that it doesn't use 3D acceleration. Instead of being composed of triangles in 3D space, every single object in this game (to my knowledge) is defined by basic shapes and vectors in 2D space. You might think that this would be a detriment, but instead it allows the game to produce fluid, smooth, and very organic looking effects that would be almost impossible to with traditional 3D graphics. If you're as interested in this as I am, get the iPad version instead: once you've beaten the game, you can play through in wireframe mode and check out the way it's put together.

3800720.review:
Windosill is small and short (literally, see below) physics-based puzzle game with an interesting artistic style.

The game is basically divided into rooms, each with it's very own puzzle which you have to solve in order to proceed to the next room. Considering the game is purely based on Flash the amount and realization of physics effects is quite impressive.

Unfortunately, with an average playtime of around 30-40 minutes, the game is really short and doesn't really offer that much replay value. Once you've played through the game you can probably beat it in around 10 minutes or even less.

Since it's a Flash game the game size is fairly small. The fully downloaded game just takes about 7.5 MB of HDD space, so atleast it isn't clogging up the HDD.

Basically half of the game can be played at [> http://windosill.com/ <] for free, so if you want to try it out I suggest you play the free demo version and save your money for another Indie game, which offers a bit more bang for the buck.
